name: Ajocaml
tagline: Implementation of the aspect join calculus based on JoCaml
body:
Aspect JoCaml is an implementation of the aspect join calculus described in "Chemical Foundations of Distributed Aspects" [1].

### Downloading

You can download Aspect JoCaml at <https://github.com/tabareau/AJoCaml>. 
It requires OCaml 4.02 and JoCaml 4.01.

### Examples

The distribution comes with an example of buffer replication.
### Authors and Contributors
Nicolas Tabareau and Éric Tanter

### Bibliography

[1] Chemical Foundations of Distributed Aspects Tabareau N., Tanter éric, submitted .

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with Pages? Check out our [documentation](https://help.github.com/pages) or [contact support](https://github.com/contact) and we’ll help you sort it out.
